column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Lycium barbarum L. , also known as goji , is a perennial deciduous shrub planted in large areas in the west of China .
#Text=It prefers to grow in sunny ; cold weather ; and moist , fertile soil .
#Text=Goji berry is also an excellent medicinal herb and healthy food .
#Text=The fruit is rich in vitamins , essential amino acids , and linoleic acid .
#Text=These nutrients can promote blood flow and prevent arteriosclerosis .

#Text=Long-term consumption of goji berry can also help to prevent fat accumulation in the liver , improve cell metabolism , and ensure regular body metabolism , thus playing an essential role in slowing down aging of the body .

#Text=Furthermore , goji berry also has effects on the reduction of inflammation and fever , the elimination of phlegm , liver protection , diabetes prevention , cough relief , moistening of the lungs , and mucus removal .
#Text=Recently , the beneficial effects of goji berry have been gradually recognized by people , and the fruit is rapidly becoming an indispensable food supplement .

#Text=Previous studies have shown that total phenolics , total flavonoid , and total polysaccharide contents of goji fruits from 13 different regions in China ranged from 6.899 – 8.253 mg gallic acid equivalents/g dry weight ( DW ) , 3.177 – 6.144 mg rutin equivalents/g DW , and 23.62 – 42.45 mg/g DW , indicating that the goji berry from Guyuan of Ningxia was most similar to Daodi herbs .

#Text=Liu et al. reported a comparative analysis of carotenoid accumulation in red fruit of Lycium barbarum L. and black fruit of Lycium ruthenicum L. , finding more extensive contents of carotenoids in red fruit than in black fruit .
#Text=Nitrogen fertilizer is an essential nutrient that has an important impact on crop growth , yield , and product quality .
#Text=The proper application of nitrogen fertilizer can increase the soil ’s nitrogen content for better plant growth .
#Text=Several studies investigated the absorption , assimilation , and effects of nitrogen fertilizer on plant development .
#Text=Nitrogen is mainly absorbed in the form of nitrates and ammonium salts , but may also be absorbed in organic form ( e.g. , urea or amino acids ) .
#Text=The assimilation of inorganic N and organic N requires a series of strictly regulated enzyme catalysis steps .

#Text=The growth and development , yield , and quality of goji are all quantitatively limited by nitrogen demand , where either too much or too little nitrogen can inhibit the growth and development of goji .
#Text=Previous studies showed that about 20 % of the nitrogen absorbed during the growth and development of goji comes from fertilizers , with 80 % coming from the soil .

#Text=In two-year-old goji , nitrogen uptake from the fast-growing period to the fruit-harvesting period ( from early May to mid-August ) continuously increased during the annual growth cycle and in early May to late June .

#Text=The nitrogen content of the fertilizer absorbed by the plant was higher than that of the total nitrogen , indicating that these two periods were the peak period of nitrogen absorption and the key period for nitrogen fertilizer application .

#Text=It was also found that the greatest effect of fertilizers on the growth of goji shoots in spring time was observed in response to nitrogen fertilizer , followed by phosphate fertilizer and , lastly , potash fertilizer .
#Text=Most of the studies on goji berry mainly focused on the effects of goji berry on human health , as well as the antioxidant activity of goji berry through phytochemical analysis .
#Text=The impact of fertilizer on the metabolites of goji berry has not yet been reported .

#Text=Although many reports have identified the pharmacological properties , biological activity , and nutrient benefits of goji berry , the relationship between fertilization and the goji berry metabolome is still under-reported .

#Text=In this study , we utilized an integrated UPLC-ESI-MS/MS detection system to study the effects of different nitrogen fertilizations on the yield and metabolites of goji berry and provided a theoretical model for the regulation of goji berries ’ nutrient compounds by fertilization .
